title: ‘Ralston Crawford: Air & Space & War’ Review: Art and Aviation
sub_head: Inspired by the military aircraft and nuclear explosions he witnessed at Bikini Atoll, the paintings and photographs on view at the Brandywine River Museum of Art trace the American modernist’s stylistic evolution throughout World War II.
body:
Chadds Ford, Pa.
In Michihiko Hachiya’s book “Hiroshima Diary: The Journal of a Japanese Physician August 6-September 30, 1945,” Dr. Hachiya and other eyewitnesses to the detonation of Little Boy over Hiroshima describe the brilliant, beautiful and destructive pikadon—a term, then coined, for the atom bomb. Pika translates as glitter, sparkle or bright light, like a flash of lightning, and don as a deafening boom.
